doc.field: 2040 Draft Local Forecast Land Use and Real Estate Variables
2040 Draft Local Forecast Land Use and Real Estate Variables

This file includes Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ) level land use and real estate inputs informing the local forecast model. 2040 Draft Local Forecasts were released in February 2014. The file shows the most recent land use policy inputs used in the forecast model. The file also shows inputs about real estate land consumption rates, single family detached lot sizes, estimated rents, and estimated construction costs.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><eainfo><overview><eaover>Attributes
TAZ: TAZ number
Max_Type: Indicated whether the values in the next two fields (i.e. Resident, Large_Lot) represent the maximum number of acres allowed in the Planned Land Use or the maximum housing units allowed in the Planned Land Use.
Max Acres = maximum acres Max HU = maximum housing units
Resident: Number of acres or housing units (see Max_Type description) designated in 2030 Planned Land Use for residential uses, excluding mixed uses and large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre). Includes mixed land use acres that allow for residential uses.
Large_Lot: Number of acres or housing units (see Max_Type description) designated in 2030 Planned Land Use for large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre)
NonRes: Number of acres designated in 2030 Planned Land Use for nonresidential uses (excluding institutional uses). Includes mixed land use acres that allow for nonresidential uses.
Inst: Number of acres designated in 2030 Planned Land Use for institutional uses
SFDS_LAND: Estimated average zonal land consumption (in acres) for small lot single family detached homes (<.25 acre). Includes land consumed by local street network.
SFDM_LAND: Estimated average zonal land consumption (in acres) for medium lot single family detached homes (>=.25 acre and <1 acre). Includes land consumed by local street network.
SFDL_LAND: Estimated average zonal land consumption (in acres) for large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre). Includes land consumed by local street network.
DUPLEX_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size per unit (in acres) for small apartment buildings (i.e. between 2-4 units). Includes land consumed by local street network.
TH_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size per unit (in acres) for single family attached units (e.g. townhomes). Includes land consumed by local street network.
APT_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size per unit (in acres) for large apartment buildings (i.e. >= 5 units). Includes land consumed by local street network.
CONDO_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size per unit (in acres) for condominiums. Includes land consumed by local street network.
MH_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) for manufactured homes. Includes land consumed by local street network.
IND_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) per 1,000 built square feet of industrial units. Includes land consumed by local street network.
OFC_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) per 1,000 built square feet of office units. Includes land consumed by local street network.
COM_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) per 1,000 built square feet of commercial units. Includes land consumed by local street network.
INS_LAND: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) per 1,000 built square feet of institutional units. Includes land consumed by local street network.
SFDS_LOT: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) for small lot single family detached homes (<.25 acre)
SFDM_LOT: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) for medium lot single family detached homes (>=.25 acre and <1 acre)
SFDL_LOT: Estimated average zonal lot size (in acres) for small lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre)
SFDS_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for small lot single family detached homes (<.25 acre)
SFDM_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for medium lot single family detached homes (>=.25 acre and <1 acre)
SFDL_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre)
SFA_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for single family attached units (e.g. townhomes)
DUP_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for small apartment building units (i.e. between 2-4 units)
APT_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for large apartment building units (i.e. >= 5 units)
CONDO_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for condominium units
MH_SQFT: Estimated average zonal built (or finished) square feet for manufactured homes
SFDS_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for small lot single family detached homes (<.25 acre)
SFDM_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for medium lot single family detached homes (>=.25 acre and <1 acre)
SFDL_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre)
SFA_Rent: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for single family attached units (e.g. townhomes)
DUP_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for small apartment buildings (i.e. between 2-4 units)
APT_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for large apartment buildings (i.e. >= 5 units)
CONDO_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for condominiums
MH_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent for manufactured homes
IND_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent per 1,000 built square feet of industrial space
OFC_RENT: Estimated average zonal montly rent per 1,000 built square feet of office space
COM_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent per 1,000 built square feet of commercial space
INS_RENT: Estimated average zonal monthly rent per 1,000 built square feet of institutional space
SFDS_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for small lot single family detached homes (<.25 acre)
SFDM_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for medium lot single family detached homes (>=.25 acre and <1 acre)
SFDL_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for large lot single family detached homes (>=1 acre)
SFA_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for for single family attached units (e.g. townhomes)
DUP_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for small apartment buildings (i.e. between 2-4 units)
APT_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for large apartment buildings (i.e. >= 5 units)
CONDO_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for condominiums
MH_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost for manufactured home
IND_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost per 1,000 built square feet of industrial space
OFC_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost per 1,000 built square feet of office space
COM_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost per 1,000 built square feet of commercial space
INS_COST: Estimated average zonal monthly construction cost per 1,000 built square feet of institutional space
</eaover></overview></eainfo><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Metropolitan Council</origin><title>2040 Draft Local Forecast Land Use and Real Estate Variables</title><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council</publish></pubinfo><pubdate>20140312</pubdate><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/DraftForecastLandUseAndRealEstate2040.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This file includes Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ) level land use and real estate inputs informing the local forecast model. 2040 Draft Local Forecasts were released in February 2014. The file shows the most recent land use policy inputs used in the forecast model. The file also shows inputs about real estate land consumption rates, single family detached lot sizes, estimated rents, and estimated construction costs.
</abstract><purpose>To show information about land use and real estate characteristics used in the local forecast model. </purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 county metropolitan area. The file details the land use and real estate characteristic data informing the local forecast model. The information in this file originate from a number of different data sources. The calculation of planned land use acres and allowable housing types is based on Regional Planned Land Use for the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area file, which is a compilation of individual land use plans from communities within the seven-county Twin Cities metropolitan area into a single regional data layer. Estimated average residential zonal land consumption and average zonal lot sizes were estimated using a combination of 2010 Census ACS housing unit counts, 2010 Census counts of owner and rental households, and summarizations of both the 2010 Generalized Land Use and parcel data.
Estimated nonresidential land use (per 1,000 square feet) are based on analysis of 2010 Generalized Land Use, Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development (DEED) Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) data, and Minnesota Commercial Association of Realtors (MnCAR) data.
Estimated average zonal residential finished square footage values used summarizations of parcel data, Minnesota Area Association of Realtors (MAAR data), and GVA Marquette data.
Estimated average zonal residential rents were calculated based on data from the 2010 ACS Census data and analysis of Minnesota Area Association of Realtors (MAAR data) sales data.
Estimated average zonal nonresidential rents were calculated using analysis of MnCAR data.
Supply costs were estimated by combining estimations of land supply costs and building costs. Land supply costs were estimated using geographically weighted averaging of county accessors data for vacant parcels. Average zonal monthly residential construction costs were estimated using summarizations of US Department of Commerce building permit data (for single family attached and multifamily housing) and RSMeans Residential Cost data (for single family detached housing). Average zonal monthly nonresidential construction costs were estimated using Metropolitan Council nonresidential building permit data. For zones that were considered fully developed (defined as >85% of land developed), estimated supply costs were raised 50% to account for additional costs associated with redevelopment.
</procdesc></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spref><horizsys><planar><gridsys><gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone>15</utmzone></utm></gridsys><planci><plandu>meters</plandu></planci></planar><geodetic><horizdn>NAD83</horizdn><ellips>GRS80</ellips></geodetic></horizsys></spref></metadata>
